title.narrative: Kenya - Ewaso N'giro North Natural Resources Conservation Project (ENNNRCP)
Kenya - Projet de conservation des ressources naturelles du bassin de l’Ewaso Ng’iro north (ENNNRCP)

description.narrative: Le Projet de conservation des ressources naturelles du bassin de l’Ewaso Ng’iro North (ENNNRCP) couvre les districts les plus pauvres du Kenya. Le projet est conforme à l’objectif gouvernemental d’amélioration de la qualité de vie des populations des ZASA. Il est également conforme à la stratégie de la Banque visant à promouvoir la gestion efficace des ressources naturelles en vue de la réduction de la pauvreté. Le projet est complémentaire et contribuera à améliorer l’impact de l’autre grande initiative financée par la Banque dans le secteur de l’agriculture au Kenya, à savoir le Projet d’appui à l’élevage et aux moyens d’existence en milieu rural dans les ZASA, ainsi que l’impact des activités des bailleurs de fonds dans les districts adjacents. Il comprend trois composantes : (i) la mise en valeur et la gestion des ressources en eau ; (ii) la conservation participative du bassin ; (iii) la coordination du projet et le renforcement des capacités. Le projet sera exécuté sur une période de six ans.

The Ewaso Ng’iro North Natural Resources Conservation Project (ENNNRCP) hosts the poorest districts in Kenya. The project meets the government objective of improving the quality of life for the population in the ASALs and is in line with the Bank’s strategy of promoting the efficient management of natural resources with the objective of reducing poverty. It is complementary to and enhance the impact of the other current major Bank-funded initiative in the agricultural sector, namely the ASAL-Based Livestock and Rural Livelihoods Support Project, as well as donor activities in adjacent districts. The project comprises three components: (i) Water Resources Development and Management; (ii) Participatory Catchment Conservation, (iii) Project Coordination and Capacity Building. It will be implemented over a period of 6 years.

Le projet bénéficiera directement à quelque 70.000 ménages, soit environ 20 % de la population totale de la zone du projet. Au nombre des bénéficiaires, il y a lieu de citer les associations d’utilisateurs de l’eau des cours d’eau, les associations d’utilisateurs de l’eau et des forêts, les groupes chargés des pépinières arboricoles, les éleveurs, les agro-éleveurs, les apiculteurs, et les fonctionnaires de l’ENNDA et des ministères concernés au niveau des districts. Les femmes devraient représenter environ 20 % des bénéficiaires.

The project will directly benefit an estimated 70,000 households or about 20% of the population of the project area. The beneficiaries will include river water users associations, water and forest users associations, tree nursery groups, pastoralists, agro-pastoralists, beekeepers, ENNDA and district line ministry staff. Women are expected to make up about 20% of the beneficiaries.

Le but sectoriel est de contribuer à la réduction de la pauvreté par une conservation et une gestion durables des ressources naturelles. L’objectif spécifique du projet est d’améliorer la gestion des ressources en eau, l’utilisation des terres agricoles et la conservation des ressources forestières dans le bassin de l’Ewaso Ng’iro North (ENNR).

The sector goal is to contribute to poverty reduction through sustainable natural resources conservation and management. The project’s specific objective is to improve water resources management, agricultural land use, and forest resource conservation in the Ewaso Ng’iro North river (ENNR) catchment.

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

title.narrative: Training of trainers on water resource management
Number of groups formed and trained on participatory forest management and management of community fuel plantations
Feasibility studies on honey production undertaken
Medium Sized Dams rehabilitated and constructed
Pilot H/F borehole Early Warning System (EWS) with 10 monitoring stations set up in Wajir District

actual.value: 13 HF Radios installed. The framework for setting up of the unit developed

title.narrative: Workers trained in the maintenance of water facilities - of which women
Water Pans and Sand Dams constructed and rehabilitated
Communities trained in improved production techniques and storage techniques and increased production and income
Community leaders trained in participatory appraisal methods
Forest under participatory forest and protection
Provision and distributions of beehives to each of the 120 community beekeeping groups
RWUAs trained and participating in decisions on management of water resources
Land whose use has been improved: replanted, reforested, landscaped, etc.
Agricultural community-based projects executed (earned by women)
Training on soil and water conservation given
Rural population trained/recruited/using improved technology - of which women
Workers trained in the maintenance of water facilities
Automatic river gauging stations installed, downstream of Archer’s Post
Early Warning System (EWS) units equipped and trained in Wajir, Samburu, Mandera and Garissa
Total population benefited - of which women
Number of motorbikes provided to Agricultural, Livestock, Water and Forestry Department who were key line ministries in the implementation of the project
Boreholes and wells drilled/rehabilitated and equipped
River gauging stations upgraded to automatic readings
Community forest associations formed and trained in participatory forest and protection
Feasibility study of large water storage reservoirs completed

target.value: Feasibility study of 3 large water storage reservoirs completed and report submitted by consultants

actual.value: Feasibility studies to be finalized under counterpart funding. Final Report to be presented
